Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: நிலத்தியல்பால் நீர்திரிந் தற்றாகும் மாந்தர்க்கு இனத்தியல்ப தாகும் அறிவு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: As water changes (its nature), from the nature of the soil (in which it flows), so will the character of men resemble that of their associates.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A clear, pure stream of water is shown flowing. On the left, it flows through a lush, green meadow, and the water remains crystal clear.
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the right, the same stream flows through a toxic, muddy swamp ('நிலத்தியல்பால்'). The water instantly becomes murky, brown, and polluted ('நீர்திரிந்து').
Layered_Composition.Background: Subtly paralleling the stream, a human mind is represented. When associated with wise, clear figures ('நல்லினம்'), it remains bright. When associated with corrupt, dark figures ('தீயினம்'), it becomes clouded and dark ('அறிவு திரிந்து').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A direct analogy: just as the nature of the soil changes the water that flows through it, the nature of one's companions changes one's own mind and wisdom.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The changing quality of the water is the central metaphor. The parallel between the pure/polluted water and the clear/clouded mind makes the point explicit.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The left side is bright, with vibrant greens and clear blues. The right side is dark and sickly, with muddy browns, stagnant greens, and grey tones.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A top-down or high-angle shot that clearly shows the path of the stream and its transformation.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with hyper-realistic water effects and textures.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Split lighting, with clean, natural light on the left and polluted, dim light on the right.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Symbolic realism, with a strong visual metaphor.
